polimi.reds.broker.routing
Interface ReplyManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
ImmediateForwardReplyManager
public interface ReplyManager

It is the module which manages the replies. It interacts with a data structure, the ReplyTable, into which are registered all the interesting data of the replies such as the sender ID, the expiration timeout and the number of neighbors to which the repliable message was given.

Author:
Alessandro Monguzzi

Method Summary
 void forwardReply(Reply reply)
          Forwards a given reply towards the sender of the corresponding repliable message.
 void recordRepliableMessage(MessageID repliableMessageID, NodeDescriptor senderID, FutureInt numExpectedReplies)
          Adds a new entry in the local reply table to manage a new repliable message.
If numExpectedReplies == 0, no reply will ever arrive for this message.
 void setRouter(Router r)
          This methods set the router in the ReplyManager.
 

Method Detail

recordRepliableMessage

void recordRepliableMessage(MessageID repliableMessageID,
                            NodeDescriptor senderID,
                            FutureInt numExpectedReplies)
Adds a new entry in the local reply table to manage a new repliable message.
If numExpectedReplies == 0, no reply will ever arrive for this message. It will forward a fake last reply with the same repliableMessageID, last == true and payload == null.

Parameters:
repliableMessageID - repliable message ID
senderID - ID of the neighbor which sent the repliable message
numExpectedReplies - future value of numExpectedReplies

forwardReply

void forwardReply(Reply reply)
Forwards a given reply towards the sender of the corresponding repliable message. This method can be used to implement a no queueing system, all the replies are immediately sent and never stored. If the NodeDescriptor is not present, the reply is lost.

Parameters:
reply - the reply to be sent.

setRouter

void setRouter(Router r)
This methods set the router in the ReplyManager. The ReplyManager needs the Router to access the ReplyTable. Users do not need to call this method as The router already call this method in the constructor.

Parameters:
r - the router which holds the Reply Table
